name: Tommy Tuberville
funFact: Former head football coach at Auburn, Texas Tech, Ole Miss, and UCLA.

name: Katie Britt
funFact: At 41, became the youngest woman ever elected to the U.S. Senate.

name: Lisa Murkowski
funFact: Won re-election in 2010 as the first senator to win a write-in campaign since 1954.

name: Dan Sullivan
funFact: Served as a Marine Corps Reserve officer and as Alaska Attorney General.

name: Mark Kelly
funFact: Former NASA astronaut and U.S. Navy fighter pilot with over 375 combat hours.

name: Ruben Gallego
funFact: Marine Corps veteran who served in the Iraq War before entering politics.

name: John Boozman
funFact: Practiced optometry for over 20 years before entering politics.

name: Tom Cotton
funFact: Harvard Law graduate and Army veteran who served in Iraq and Afghanistan.

name: Alex Padilla
funFact: First Latino to represent California in the U.S. Senate.

name: Adam Schiff
funFact: Former Assistant U.S. Attorney and lead House impeachment manager in 2019.

name: Michael Bennet
funFact: Was superintendent of Denver Public Schools before being appointed to the Senate.

name: John Hickenlooper
funFact: Opened Colorado's first brewpub in 1988 before becoming Denver's mayor and then governor.

name: Richard Blumenthal
funFact: Served as Connecticut Attorney General for 20 years before entering the Senate.

name: Chris Murphy
funFact: Has been one of the Senate's most prominent voices for gun violence prevention legislation.

name: Chris Coons
funFact: Wrote a college essay called 'The Bearded Marxist,' which he says was tongue-in-cheek.

name: Lisa Blunt Rochester
funFact: Former Delaware Secretary of State and first Black woman to represent Delaware in Congress.

name: Rick Scott
funFact: Former two-term Florida governor and founder of Columbia/HCA, once the nation's largest for-profit hospital company.

name: Ashley Moody
funFact: Former Florida Attorney General appointed to fill the seat vacated by Marco Rubio.

name: Jon Ossoff
funFact: At 34, was among the youngest U.S. senators when he took office in January 2021.

name: Raphael Warnock
funFact: Senior pastor of Ebenezer Baptist Church in Atlanta, where Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. once preached.

name: Mazie Hirono
funFact: First U.S. senator born in Japan, first Buddhist senator, and first senator to give birth while in office.

name: Brian Schatz
funFact: Former CEO of Helping Hands Hawaii, a social services nonprofit, before entering politics.

name: Mike Crapo
funFact: A member of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, he does not drink alcohol.

name: Jim Risch
funFact: Served as Idaho Governor for just 9 months in 2006 after the sitting governor resigned.

name: Tammy Duckworth
funFact: Lost both legs serving as a Black Hawk helicopter pilot in Iraq in 2004.

name: Dick Durbin
funFact: Served as Senate Majority Whip, the second-ranking Senate Democrat, for many years.

name: Todd Young
funFact: Marine Corps veteran and former CIA analyst before becoming a congressman.

name: Jim Banks
funFact: Navy Reserve officer who served in Afghanistan, and former U.S. Representative.

name: Chuck Grassley
funFact: One of the longest-serving senators in U.S. history. Famously tends his own corn and soybean farm.

name: Joni Ernst
funFact: Former combat veteran and Iowa National Guard commander who ran memorable 'make 'em squeal' campaign ads.

name: Jerry Moran
funFact: Grew up on a farm in Plainville, Kansas, and has a long record of advocating for rural America.

name: Roger Marshall
funFact: OB/GYN physician who delivered over 5,000 babies before entering politics.

name: Mitch McConnell
funFact: Longest-serving Senate Republican leader in history.

name: Rand Paul
funFact: Board-certified ophthalmologist who founded his own certification board after a dispute with the official board.

name: Bill Cassidy
funFact: Gastroenterologist who helped establish a free health clinic for uninsured patients in Baton Rouge.

name: John Kennedy
funFact: Known for colorful one-liners on the Senate floor. Studied law at Oxford on a Rhodes Scholarship.

name: Susan Collins
funFact: Known as a moderate Republican, she is the longest-serving senator in Maine history.

name: Angus King
funFact: One of two independent senators who caucuses with Democrats. Former two-term Maine governor.

name: Chris Van Hollen
funFact: Born in Karachi, Pakistan, where his father was a U.S. diplomat.

name: Angela Alsobrooks
funFact: Former Prince George's County Executive and the first Black woman elected to the Senate from Maryland.

name: Elizabeth Warren
funFact: Former Harvard Law professor who helped create the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.

name: Ed Markey
funFact: Co-author of the Green New Deal resolution. Served in the House for 37 years before the Senate.

name: Gary Peters
funFact: Navy Reserve officer and former investment adviser who is a licensed skydiver.

name: Elissa Slotkin
funFact: Former CIA analyst and Defense Department official who served three tours in Iraq.

name: Amy Klobuchar
funFact: First woman elected to the Senate from Minnesota. Her father Al Klobuchar was a legendary sportswriter.

name: Tina Smith
funFact: Former Planned Parenthood executive and Lt. Governor appointed to fill Al Franken's seat.

name: Roger Wicker
funFact: Avid musician who plays multiple instruments. Received a threatening letter via mail in 2013.

name: Cindy Hyde-Smith
funFact: First woman to represent Mississippi in Congress, appointed then elected in a 2018 runoff.

name: Josh Hawley
funFact: Yale Law graduate and former Missouri AG.

name: Eric Schmitt
funFact: Former Missouri Attorney General who filed over 40 lawsuits against the Biden administration.

name: Steve Daines
funFact: Worked for Procter & Gamble in China for several years before returning to Montana.

name: Tim Sheehy
funFact: Navy SEAL veteran and founder of Bridger Aerospace, a Montana aerial firefighting company.

name: Deb Fischer
funFact: Raises cattle on her family's ranch near Valentine, Nebraska.

name: Pete Ricketts
funFact: Part-owner of the Chicago Cubs. Former two-term Nebraska governor appointed to the Senate.

name: Catherine Cortez Masto
funFact: First Latina U.S. senator in history. Served as Nevada's Attorney General for eight years.

name: Jacky Rosen
funFact: Former computer programmer and synagogue president who had never held public office before her House win.

name: Jeanne Shaheen
funFact: First person in U.S. history to be elected both governor and U.S. senator in the same state.

name: Maggie Hassan
funFact: Former two-term New Hampshire governor. Her advocacy for disability rights was shaped by her son's cerebral palsy.

name: Cory Booker
funFact: Vegan who famously moved into a Newark housing project as mayor to better understand residents' lives.

name: Andy Kim
funFact: Former National Security Council director and the first Korean American senator.

name: Martin Heinrich
funFact: Mechanical engineer by training and avid hunter, he brings a rural perspective to Democratic environmental debates.

name: Ben Ray Luján
funFact: First Native American senator from New Mexico, with Tewa Pueblo heritage.

name: Chuck Schumer
funFact: Senate Majority Leader known for holding weekly Sunday press conferences to drive the week's news cycle.

name: Kirsten Gillibrand
funFact: Appointed to Hillary Clinton's seat in 2009. Has carried a handgun in her pickup truck.

name: Thom Tillis
funFact: Started his career at IBM and worked his way up to executive director of PricewaterhouseCoopers.

name: Ted Budd
funFact: Owner of a gun shop and shooting range in Advance, NC called ProShots Products.

name: John Hoeven
funFact: Former five-term North Dakota governor who oversaw a major oil boom in the Bakken formation.

name: Kevin Cramer
funFact: Former North Dakota Public Service Commissioner and an ordained minister.

name: Bernie Moreno
funFact: Colombian-born businessman and car dealership owner endorsed by Donald Trump over the incumbent.

name: Jon Husted
funFact: Former Ohio Lt. Governor and Secretary of State, appointed to fill JD Vance's vacated seat.

name: Markwayne Mullin
funFact: Former MMA fighter who made headlines for challenging a union leader to a fight on the Senate floor.

name: James Lankford
funFact: Former Baptist youth camp director who negotiated a bipartisan border security deal in early 2024.

name: Ron Wyden
funFact: Co-founder of the Oregon Legal Services Center and a leading advocate for internet privacy rights.

name: Jeff Merkley
funFact: Only senator to have endorsed Bernie Sanders in 2016. Sleeps on a cot in his Senate office.

name: John Fetterman
funFact: Known for wearing Carhartt shorts and hoodies in the Senate chamber, prompting a dress code debate.

name: Dave McCormick
funFact: Former hedge fund CEO who served in the U.S. Army as a paratrooper with the 82nd Airborne Division.

name: Jack Reed
funFact: West Point graduate and former Army Ranger who is the longest-serving senator in Rhode Island history.

name: Sheldon Whitehouse
funFact: Former Rhode Island AG who has given over 290 Senate floor speeches on climate change.

name: Lindsey Graham
funFact: First Air Force JAG officer elected to the Senate. Was a main prosecutor in President Clinton's impeachment trial.

name: Tim Scott
funFact: First Black Republican senator from the South since Reconstruction. Briefly ran for president in 2024.

name: John Thune
funFact: Former college basketball player who unseated Senate Majority Leader Tom Daschle in 2004. Became Senate Majority Leader in 2025.

name: Mike Rounds
funFact: Former four-term South Dakota governor who worked as an insurance agent before entering politics.

name: Marsha Blackburn
funFact: Former saleswoman who ran a clothing wholesale business before entering the Tennessee legislature.

name: Bill Hagerty
funFact: Former U.S. Ambassador to Japan under President Trump. Speaks Japanese.

name: John Cornyn
funFact: Former Texas Attorney General and Texas Supreme Court Justice before entering the Senate.

name: Ted Cruz
funFact: Former Solicitor General of Texas who argued nine cases before the U.S. Supreme Court.

name: Mike Lee
funFact: Son of former U.S. Solicitor General Rex Lee. Was a law clerk for Supreme Court Justice Samuel Alito.

name: John Curtis
funFact: Former mayor of Provo and avid cyclist known as one of the more moderate GOP voices on climate.

name: Bernie Sanders
funFact: Longest-serving independent in congressional history. Twice ran for the Democratic presidential nomination.

name: Peter Welch
funFact: First Democrat ever elected to Vermont's at-large House seat, serving 16 years there before the Senate.

name: Mark Warner
funFact: Made his fortune as an early investor and promoter of cell phone networks. Former Virginia governor.

name: Tim Kaine
funFact: Former mayor of Richmond, Virginia governor, and Hillary Clinton's 2016 running mate. Speaks Spanish fluently.

name: Patty Murray
funFact: Described herself as 'just a mom in tennis shoes' when she first ran in 1992. Third-longest serving Senate Democrat.

name: Maria Cantwell
funFact: Former tech executive who worked at RealNetworks and was an early investor in internet companies.

name: Shelley Moore Capito
funFact: Daughter of former West Virginia governor Arch Moore. First woman elected to Senate from West Virginia.

name: Jim Justice
funFact: Billionaire businessman and owner of The Greenbrier resort. One of the tallest governors in U.S. history at 6'7".

name: Ron Johnson
funFact: Plastics manufacturer who pledged to serve only two terms but ran and won a third in 2022.

name: Tammy Baldwin
funFact: First openly gay person elected to the U.S. Senate. Former U.S. Representative for 14 years.

name: John Barrasso
funFact: Orthopedic surgeon who was team physician for the Wyoming Cowboys and Cowgirls athletics.

name: Cynthia Lummis
funFact: Rancher and one of the first members of Congress to hold Bitcoin and advocate for crypto legislation.
